Subjective: Dizziness for 3 days. Room spinning sensation, worse with head movement. No vomiting, headache, hearing loss, speech problems, limb weakness. No smoking, alcohol, drugs. Friend with brain tumor, concerned about serious cause. Impact: limiting daily activities.
Objective: BP 110/70, HR 62. No nystagmus. HIT test negative bilaterally. Dix-Hallpike maneuver reproduces vertigo and nystagmus. No other neurological deficits.
Assessment: Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV). No signs of central cause or brain tumor.
Plan: 1. Perform Epley maneuver in clinic. 2. Provide instructions for home Epley maneuver via thuisarts.nl. 3. Reassure patient that symptoms are not consistent with brain tumor. 4. Follow up if symptoms persist or worsen.
